DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cardiovascular Disorder  Acute Coronary Syndrome Risk Factor Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient has a cardiovascular risk associated with acute coronary syndromes, coronary angioplasty, or stenting that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cardiovascular Disorder  Acute Coronary Syndrome Risk Factor Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma._Signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction._Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cardiovascular Disorder Acute Coronary Syndrome Risk Factor Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.:Signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction.:Something that increases the chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer are age, a family history of certain cancers, use of tobacco products, being exposed to radiation or certain chemicals, infection with certain viruses or bacteria, and certain genetic changes.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.

Signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction.
Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction or unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within the past 24 weeks prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of acute coronary syndromes (including unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within the past 24 weeks; Class II, III, or IV heart failure as defined by the New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional classification system or history of known cardiac arrhythmias unless it has been stably controlled?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have current evidence of significant cardiovascular disease (New York Heart Association Class III or IV cardiac disease), symptomatic congestive heart failure, dilated/hypertrophic or restrictive cardiomyopathy, myocardial infarction (within the past 6 months), unstable angina or evidence of acute ischemia on ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have history or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of cardiovascular risk associated with acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction and unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cardiovascular disease that meets one of the following: congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Class III or IV), active angina pectoris, or recent myocardial infarction (within the last 6 months)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction or unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within the 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction or unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of significant cardiovascular disease, defined as: Congestive heart failure greater than New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III according to the NYHA functional classification, unstable angina or myocardial infarction within 6 months of enrollment or serious cardiac arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a myocardial infarction less than 6 months before the start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or evidence of cardiovascular risks including QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's formula QTcF greater than or equal to 450 msec;  acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction or unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within the past 24 weeks prior to randomization; current Class II, III, or IV heart failure as defined by the New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional classification system; intra-cardiac defibrillators; abnormal cardiac valve morphology (greater than or equal to grade 2) documented by ECHO (patient with grade 1 abnormalities [i.e., mild regurgitation/stenosis] can be entered on study); moderate valvular thickening; current clinically significant uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmias; clarification(patients with atrial fibrillation controlled for greater than 30 days prior to dosing are eligible); treatment refractory hypertension defined as a blood pressure of systolic greater than140 mmHg and/or diastolic greater than 90 mm Hg which cannot be controlled by anti-hypertensive therapy; left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than institutional lower limit of normal (LLN) by ECHO or MUGA or known cardiac metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's AL Amyloidosis Cardiac Risk stage I, II or IIIa disease based on the 2013 European Modification of the 2004 Standard Mayo Clinic Staging in patients with advanced cardiac involvement (Dispenzieri et al., 2004; Wechalekar et al., 2013) as defined in section 3.1.12?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient classified as class 2B or better using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or current uncontrolled cardiovascular disease including: unstable angina, myocardial infarction, or known congestive heart failure Class II-IV within the preceding 12 months; cerebrovascular accident or transient ischemic attack within the preceding 3 months; any of the following: sustained ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation, Torsades de Pointes, cardiac arrest, Mobitz II second degree heart block or third degree heart block; known presence of dilated, hypertrophic, or restrictive cardiomyopathy; QTc prolongation as confirmed by triplicate assessment at screening (Fridericia QTc greater than 480 milliseconds)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months prior to the first dose of ZEN003694 (ZEN-3694)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 8/5/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
